main event: On 23 April 1949, an observer sighted a triangular-shaped object over Vicksburg, Mississippi, which appeared milky white and moved eastward at a moderate speed.
interesting points: The object was described as having a triangular shape with a length of approximately 4 ft on each side and 1.5 ft wide., It emitted a milky fluorescence similar to fluorescent light., There were lights running along the sides of the triangle., The object reportedly had no sound or visible propulsion system and disappeared without a trace., The sighting lasted between 5-10 seconds.
witness description: The witness is a carpenter from Vicksburg, who described the object as traveling faster than regular planes but slower than jets.
